org.wicketstuff.security

Class WaspSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.wicket.Session
      • org.apache.wicket.protocol.http.WebSession
        • org.wicketstuff.security.WaspSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, org.apache.wicket.event.IEventSink, org.apache.wicket.util.io.IClusterable

    public class WaspSession
extends org.apache.wicket.protocol.http.WebSession
    Session for keeping the session scoped IAuthorizationStrategy and for providing easy access to login, logoff and isAuthenticated.
    Author:
    marrink
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • login

        public void login(Object context)
           throws LoginException
        Attempts to login with the current login info.
        Parameters:
        context - any type of information required to login
        Throws:
        LoginException
        See Also:
        WaspAuthorizationStrategy.login(Object)

      • logoff

        public boolean logoff(Object context)
        Attempts to log off the current user. Even though this call Already handles dirty flags. The WaspAuthorizationStrategy should also do the same as it is not guaranteed that every logoff comes from the session.
        Parameters:
        context - the context to use for logging off
        Returns:
        true, if the logoff was successful, false otherwise
        See Also:
        WaspAuthorizationStrategy.logoff(Object)

      • isUserAuthenticated

        public boolean isUserAuthenticated()
        Quick check if any user at all is currently authenticated.
        Returns:
        true if an authenticated user is present, false otherwise

      • invalidateNow

        public void invalidateNow()
        Cleans up the WaspAuthorizationStrategy before killing this session. If you override this method you must call super.invalidateNow().
        Overrides:
        invalidateNow in class org.apache.wicket.Session
        See Also:
        Session.invalidateNow()
